cause.description:
Child & Adolescent Bipolar Foundation www.bpkids.org
CABF offers the following programs on its Web site:
Online Information Center Expert Chat Message Boards Online Support Groups Online database of doctors & local support groups Teen programming Downloadable audio show Resource page with Social Security, Insurance, Medicaid links Research Studies and Clinical Trials open to children Bookstore and Gallery of children’s art and poetry CABF is a national, not-for-profit organization
CABF currently supports thousands of parents whose children have Bipolar Disorder, but the hope and dream of CABF is to one day change the stigma attached to children who have the disease and to educate the people deal with these children on a daily basis such as teachers, doctors, and mental health care workers. CABF supports research on new and better treatments and possible cures.
CABF needs your help. By joining and sharing the cause with others on Facebook, it gives CABF a better chance to actually achieve its mission. By donating to CABF, you will be helping thousands of families who are desperate for help.
1. See http://www.bpkids.org/fd_goals for more information.
cause.mission: CABF improves the lives of families raising children and teens living with bipolar disorder and related conditions.
